title: Representing Distance with Algebraic Expression
text: The distance from $$x$$ to $$5$$ can be represented using an absolute value symbol, $$|x-5|$$.
speech: The distance from  x  to  5  can be represented using an absolute value symbol, , the absolute value of x minus 5, end absolute value .

title: Defining Inequality
text: All values of $$x$$ that satisfy the condition can be represented as the inequality: $$|x-5| \leq 4$$.

title: Absolute Value Inequalities
text: $$|X| \leq k$$ is equivalent to $$-k \leq X \leq k$$.

title: Applying the Formula for Absolute Value Inequalities
text: $$|x-5| \leq 4$$ can be written as two inequalities: $$x-5 \leq 4$$ and $$x-5 \geq -4$$.
speech: the absolute value of x minus 5, end absolute value is less than or equal to, 4  can be written as two inequalities:  x, minus 5 is less than or equal to 4  and  x, minus 5 is greater than or equal to, negative 4 .

title: Solution Set
text: The two inequalities we get from solving $$x-5 \leq 4$$ and $$x-5 \geq -4$$ are: $$x \leq 9$$ and $$x \geq 1$$.
